image.altText: Computer generated depictions of unlabelled paracetamol tables coming out of a box with warning signs.

props.synopsis: Australia is reducing the availability of paracetamol to prevent self-harm overdoses, which the ABC can reveal is particularly prevalent among young girls and teens. WARNING: This story contains references to acts of self-harm.

title.children: Sales crackdown imminent as more women and girls are overdosing on paracetamol

image.altText: A elderly woman looks at the camera while an elderly man holds her and leans his head against her.

props.synopsis: Dick and Pixie von Hofe have just celebrated 70 years of marriage, and say hard work, determination and, of course, love are the key ingredients.

title.children: After 70 years, Dick and Pixie share recipe for long life on the land

image.altText: A round, black surveillance camera is pictured to the right of the Chinese flag outside.

props.synopsis: Three men are jailed in Perth for their "crude" attempt to extort money from a Chinese businessman, after torturing him using pliers and a dog collar that emitted electric shocks over a period of more than 50 hours.

title.children: Chinese businessman's Perth kidnappers jailed for dog collar torture

image.altText: An aerial view of a highway cutting through rugged landscape

props.synopsis: There's hope a new reward could lead to information about six Indigenous men who disappeared in suspicious circumstances across northern WA.

title.children: WA offers $500,000 reward to help solve long-term missing persons cases

image.altText: She sits by the ocean wearing a blazer and holding a photograph of her dad, who is wearing a wetsuit and has white hair

props.synopsis: Rural communities fear the high cost of asbestos removal puts the public at risk, as uninsured home owners fail to clean up the deadly material after house fires.

title.children: Asbestos removal stalls as uninsured home owners baulk at clean-up cost

image.altText: Two female forensics officers stand outside a property on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: West Australian police have charged a 32-year-old woman with murder following the death of a man in Geraldton.

title.children: Woman charged with murder over man's death in WA's Midwest

props.synopsis: Your guide to finding the best stories from ABC News reporters in Perth and across WA.

title.children: Welcome to WA Top Stories, where local news lives

image.altText: Men with pixilated features look at the camera, inside a factory.

props.synopsis: Migrant workers allege exploitation by Kawaguchi Manufacturing, accusing the supplier for Sony, Panasonic and Daikin of not paying wages and withholding passports.

title.children: Sony, Panasonic 'cut and run' from Malaysian supplier accused of wage theft

image.altText: Two sitting figures are seen in silhouette against the ocean and last light of the setting sun.

props.synopsis: Australians on the frontline of climate change are fighting to save their vanishing ancestral home. Can a landmark lawsuit against the federal government save their way of life?

title.children: Islanders fight to keep hope and culture alive as Torres Strait rises

image.altText: A man wedged between two woman, all wearing sunglasses while smiling at the camera by the beach

props.synopsis: Kerryn Draper was among hundreds of Australians stranded in Bali after a recent volcanic eruption. She returned with a cautionary tale about the financial and mental pressure of not being able to get home.

title.children: How a long-awaited dream trip to Bali quickly turned sour

image.altText: A young white woman who is blind holding a large straw hat

props.synopsis: Next time you're scrolling for bargains online, consider the half a million Australians who don't find shopping on the web fun or simple, writes Nas Campanella.

title.children: 'Like you don't matter': Why Aussies like me struggle with online shopping

image.altText: Composite image of Nathan McSweeney, Mohammed Siraj and Usman Khawaja on day one of the third Test between Australia and India.

props.synopsis: Mohammed Siraj cops boos from the fans, who get their money back as rain restricts day one to just 13 overs, but there was still time for Australia's openers to impress. Here are the quick hits from the first day at the Gabba.

title.children: Five quick hits: Fans take aim at new Indian villain and get a refund for rain-soaked day

image.altText: A hijabi woman in green medical scrubs looks up while standing in front of a ruined house

props.synopsis: Hundreds of doctors, journalists and others are dying in Gaza, international bodies say, alleging they are being targeted by the Israeli military for doing their job.

title.children: Medics, journalists and rescuers are being killed at work in Gaza

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: OK, know-it-all … prove just how much you know in this week's Hard Quiz!

title.children: Think you know it all? Only the sharpest minds can ace this quiz!

image.altText: Four women stand shoulder to shoulder looking at camera, behind is bulldozer in a cleared forest

props.synopsis: Reece Whitby's decision to overturn a number of proposed restrictions on South32's Worsley Alumina mine disappoints locals who banded together to oppose the project.

title.children: WA environment minister effectively backs bauxite mine's expansion

image.altText: Rupert Murdoch looks directly at the camera with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch wanted to give son Lachlan future control over his empire by stripping power from his other children. But a court rejected his plan.

title.children: A court ruling has blown up Rupert Murdoch's succession plan

image.altText: Tessa Giele, Gretchen Walsh and Alexandria Perkins posing on the podium, holding their medals

props.synopsis: Alex Perkins and Matt Temple grabbed bronze medals for Australia on a record-shattering day, again dominated by US sensation Gretchen Walsh.

title.children: Aussies win medals as American Walsh continues championship domination

image.altText: Alex Thomas, the referee issues instructions, by raising his arms, outstretched

props.synopsis: A match in England's second-tier rugby union league has been abandoned after the referee was knocked unconscious.

title.children: Rugby match abandoned after referee knocked out by football

image.altText: A lychee farmer holding a bunch of lychees on an orchard.

props.synopsis: From natural disasters to financial ruin, Eddie Cowie's Queensland lychee farm is finally showing signs of life again after nearly a decade of turmoil.

title.children: From fire to fruit, first harvest in years bittersweet for lychee farmers

image.altText: The back view of a woman with long hair, outside, with pink and green shadows and light around her.

props.synopsis: A leading psychologist says the case involving a woman with dissociative identity disorder gained worldwide attention from those who study and live with multiple personalities.

title.children: 'Relief' as court helps victim give evidence in multiple personalities

image.altText: Yung Filly walking out of court, surrounded by media.

props.synopsis: YouTube personality Yung Filly is charged with reckless driving while out on bail in Perth where he's accused of sexually assaulting a woman while on an Australian tour.

title.children: YouTuber Yung Filly charged with driving at 158kph in Perth while on bail

image.altText: Former NFL wide receiver Randy Moss sitting in the cold, wearing a beanie and jacket, wearing a headset microphone

props.synopsis: American Football Hall of Famer Randy Moss has said he is recovering from a cancer surgery and will undergo radiation and chemotherapy.

title.children: NFL great Randy Moss says he had surgery to remove bile duct cancer

image.altText: A numbat in grassland.

props.synopsis: Conservation scientists credit the curbing of introduced predators with a rebound in the population of endangered iconic numbats in Western Australia.

title.children: Joey sightings a welcome sign for this endangered WA marsupial

image.altText: An illustration of a glowing yellow sun and people floating among stacks of books

props.synopsis: Here's our wrap of the best books of 2024. Novels by Sally Rooney, Tim Winton and Booker Prize winner Samantha Harvey top our critics' favourite reads of the year.

title.children: Sex, chess and time travel: Welcome to the best books of 2024

image.altText: Dominic Field is dressed in a green wig and a green theatrical outfit, and is posing for the camera as the Tree of Wisdom.

props.synopsis: Dominic Field has been part of the extended Wiggles family since he was born, but his latest role as the Tree of Knowledge has taken his career to new heights. He shares how he finds time to relax and enjoy his downtime.

title.children: TikTok star Wiggles’ Tree of Wisdom on dancing hard and switching off

image.altText: Merav Solomon wears a blue shirt and is pictured in a park.

props.synopsis: After a suspected terror attack on a Melbourne synagogue, Jewish Australians reflect on their hopes and fears.

title.children: A week on, Australia’s Jewish community feeling unsettled, but supported

image.altText: A person's hands hold a phone. The screen has been blurred to obscure a video showing people injecting drugs.

props.synopsis: Footage of a man injecting women with what appear to be drugs in a public space has sparked concern about an increase in drug use in the Kimberley.

title.children: 'Disturbing' footage emerges of man injecting women with needles on WA street

image.altText: An exterior of a tall white building in a car park

props.synopsis: The expansion of Morley's Galleria in 1994 made it one of the city's best shopping destinations, but with aging facilities and many shops closed, locals want urgent action to restore the centre to its former glory.

title.children: 'Ghost town': Locals call for overhaul of former Perth retail 'cathedral'

image.altText: Roadwork signs telling drivers to slow down as a long line of cars navigate through traffic cones.

props.synopsis: Set to begin next year, the trial will see speed limits cut by at least 10kph across Margaret River and nearby communities.

title.children: Speed limits to be slashed across WA's South West in bid to cut road deaths

image.altText: A police image shows an senior white man with white hair, moustache and beard.

props.synopsis: The family of a 73-year-old prospector is worried about his welfare, nine days after he went bush north of Perth.

title.children: Hunt for prospector missing for over a week in sweltering WA bushland

image.altText: Two women and a man with his arms wrapped around them.

props.synopsis: The mother of drilling contractor Peter Groves, who died in a remote workplace incident last week, says her son was the light in the family.

title.children: Family left heartbroken after workplace death in outback WA

image.altText: A picture of Vietnamese noodle salad sitting in a bowl.

props.synopsis: Alice Zaslavsky's light and refreshing salad is perfect for summer.

title.children: Vietnamese cold noodle salad with chicken and mango

image.altText: A close-up film still of Tommy Dewey, made up like a monster, smiling, his fists resting under his chin.

props.synopsis: After Laura's boyfriend dumps her while she's in hospital recovering from cancer surgery, she finds herself falling for the creature who terrorised her as a child in this bizarre future cult classic.

title.children: Would you date a man or a monster? The lead in this film picks the latter
